items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

EXPERIENCE: beginner

COMPANY: Staff.com LLC; 75-100 employees; 75-100% remote;

SKILLS:
• JIRA
• Manual Test Execution
• Manual Testing
• Regression Testing

You will be part of the Time Doctor QA Team and your main responsibilities will be testing new features developed for our core products. You will be testing across different browsers and OS versions (mobile and desktop). Your responsibilities will include also building regression tests, perform manual testing and take part into building scenarios for automated testing with Selenium.

You are required to attend to daily stand up meetings with the QA Team and needs to submit a comprehensive report every after a smoke testing is done. You will take part into scrum management processes which includes processes of creating and testing candidate releases and production releases.

You will be responsible for:

1. Writing and executing all the test cases manually and report defects, define severity and priority for each defect
2. Carry out regression testing every time when changes are made to the code to fix defects (including in testing, staging and production servers)
3. Decide the best method of testing based on the information provided by development teams or customer support teams.
4. Prepare the status report of testing activities (written test reports, checklist spreadsheets)

To be a match for this job, you need to have:
1. Ability to reproduce issues and describe them properly for development department
2. Great understanding of technical information provided by development team or customer
3. Testing experience in Android and iOS is required
4. Have knowledge in JIRA, Basecamp, and some other project management tools

System Requirements:

1. At least [fifth generation] Corei3/Corei5 2.5+ Ghz up
2. Memory – 8GB [least is 4GB] 1TB max
3. Video – dedicated video card with at least 2GB GPU memory [PCIe – AMD or Nvidia ]
4. Hard Drive – Any 7200 RPM 500 GB or more [recommended: SSD 256 or higher, Intel, Samsung]
5. Should have a mic for recording videos on reported issues
6. Should have a working webcam to test webcam shot feature and for meeting purposes

To apply, please go to this link https://time-doctor.breezy.hr/p/7be9b6b6e850 and complete the requirements for the job.

Only those who submit the complete answers will be considered for this job.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=20, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=20, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Freelance Software QA Tester - iPhone iOS

Posted May 17

test IO
Headquarters: Remote

View all test IO jobs →

You'll be working as a freelance tester using your iPhone iOS (models 7, 8, or X), with opportunities to participate in test runs at your own discretion. You don't need to have experience in software QA (though you'll get up to speed faster if you do), but you'll need to stick with it if you've never done it before. If you haven't tested before, here are some key success factors:

  • You read instructions and understand them. If the instructions say that something is out of scope and you test it, you’re wasting your own time.
  • You communicate precisely in English. Bug reporting is a particular form of communication that demands precision, concise wording, and logical ordering.
  • You are curious. The best testers aren’t robots who follow a script. They like things that seem mysterious. They deviate from the Happy Path. They like to experiment with apps.
  • You spot patterns. Similar bugs occur in unrelated software systems, so being able to sense patterns is very helpful.
  • You like games. There does seem to be a high degree of overlap between testers and gamers. Part of it is the thrill of the hunt, and the desire to understand the rules of a system and how to beat them.

When you start as a tester at test IO, you'll get coaching from team leaders, then participate in test cycles with more experienced testers. You'll get the opportunity to see the kinds of issues they find and how they find them, so you'll be able to learn as you go along.

Apply for this position

You can get started here: https://hello.test.io/ios/

Job Description This position will be focused on ensuring the quality of the products developed by our commercial flight software team. This is a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor in an exciting new area of technology, working on a motivated team in a spectacular location in the Columbia Gorge!
As a SQA Engineer you will review software documentation for testability and standards adherence to include software systems designs, specifications and plans, evaluate functional requirements, identify implementation risks and make recommendations. You will evaluate quality goals and expectations, identify testing resources and perform testing activities.
You will design test scenarios, scripts, or procedures, make corrective/preventative action recommendations and conduct software tests/diagnostics and verify software system requirements and testability. Identify, analyze and document software behavior and find and verify defects. Evaluate test execution against traced specifications and identify gaps. Analyze test results against expected behaviors and gather technical data and perform initial test outcome analysis
We are looking for an individual who wants the opportunity to:

  • Be a key player in an agile software development team
  • Test complex software using industry best practices
  • Be responsible for assuring the delivery of high quality products and software services
  • Use metrics to understand process effectiveness, quality assurance and testing progress, and product quality and recommend actions
  • Work on leading edge products and integrations with unmanned systems
  • Work for a company that is a recognized leader in the Commercial UAS industry
  • Assess the impact of requirements, design and code changes, recommend test updates and regression testing, and execute agreed upon tests
  • Take responsibility for achieving goals and meeting project deadlines
  • Have fun in a tight knit team while working on a game changing UAS!Qualifications KEY SKILLS AND ABILTIES:
  • Knowledge of software quality practices, programming languages, operating systems and computing technology.
  • Application of technical principles, theories, and concepts.
  • Ability to develop solutions to routine technical problems.
  • Works effectively and cooperatively with others; establishes and maintains good working relationships.
  • Ability to write clear, concise technical prose.
  • Ability to apply technical knowledge and knowledge of fundamental writing skills.Prefer candidates with experience/knowledge of:
  • JIRA and Confluence
  • TestRail or other Test Management Systems.EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
    Bachelor's degree of Science from an accredited course of study, in engineering, computer science, mathematics or physics. Typical experience: 5-8 years in an engineering classification with a Bachelor's degree or 3-5 years experience in an engineering classification with a Master's degree.
    Additional Information Insitu is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Women, Individuals with Disabilities and Veterans.

items.content:
Penetration Tester - Work Remote - Australia - Jobmote

Penetration Tester - Work Remote - Australia

HackLabs

Job Description

NOTE: DO NOT APPLY FOR THIS JOB UNLESS YOU ARE A PROFESSIONAL PENETRATION TESTER AND YOUR RESUME REFLECTS AT LEAST 5 YEARS EXPERIENCE IN A POSITION WHERE THIS WAS YOUR JOB.

HackLabs is looking for motivated IT Security professionals with practical experience and expertise in Network, Web Application penetration testing, Mobile Apps, Social Engineering and SCADA plants in order to conduct engagements for our clients.

We test everything from startups to Government departments which include critical networks, complex web applications and systems.

You will ideally work with us in Sydney, Australia from our Manly Beach Labs, (located 2 min walk to beach). However there are remote working opportunities available as well. We have a laid-back office environment with no dress code. i.e. shorts, t-shirts, and flip flops (Thongs in OZ) are the norm.

On-site assessments are frequently performed in locations throughout Asia Pacific so you must be able to travel 2 weeks a month. Some months there will be no travel, others there could be three weeks, but we try our best to be considerate when scheduling our engagements to limit back to back travel weeks.

Job Description:

  • Perform assessments of customer networks. Identify, Validate and exploit security vulnerabilities Then leverage those vulnerabilities and determine the impact to the organisation of said vulnerabilities by being able to clearly illustrate the business risk within the written report.
  • Clearly communicate vulnerability details and risk to customers, both verbally and in writing.
  • Be able to independently apply testing methods against a wide variety of targets including: Web Applications, databases, wireless networks, conducting social engineering attacks against customer user base, SCADA/ICS, routing infrastructure, VPN, Cloud, and more.

Must have:

  • 8+ years experience in Information Security field

- 5 years experience conducting penetration testing

  • experience leading and managing pen testing engagements

  • excellent social skills

  • strong written and verbal communications skills

- the ability to pass a background check

  • the ability to pass a verbal technical interview

- the ability to pass a practical (hands-on) test

  • expertise in at least one Operating System

  • passion for technology and Information Security

- the ability to conduct a pen test without the use of a vulnerability scanner and exploit framework

Required Skills:

  • Deep knowledge of IP networking, Operating Systems, Information Security, security testing tools

  • Highly motivated individual with the ability to work independently and to think outside the box -- "hacker" mentality.

  • Expertise with common security tools; nmap, Nessus, Metasploit, Burp, Zap, CAIN, Linux Kali, etc.

  • Degrees and certifications are a bonus but not required provided you can demonstrate a high degree of technical skills

  • Punctuality

  • Humility - there is no room for the "rock star" hacker here

Please do NOT apply unless you have the "must haves".

Relocation allowance for the right individual.

Company DescriptionWe're a boutique Information Security firm that specialises in conducting security testing. HackLabs was founded by Industry veterans in 2009. HackLabs was acquired by PS&C (ASX:PSZ) in December 2013 and operates as a wholly owned subsidiary.
HackLabs have had extensive experience in Penetration Testing (Approximately 20 years and over 2000 penetration tests between them). HackLabs is a CREST approved organisation and Chris Gatford our founder is on the board of CREST Australia.

items.content:
QA Lead - REMOTE POSITION - Jobmote

QA Lead - REMOTE POSITION

AMS Staffing Inc.

Please send resume in Word format if you are interested in this QA Lead / Quality Assurance Lead opening - POSITION IS REMOTE!!!!!!! Salary for this role is $95K-$110K and they are looking for someone to start working immediately!!!!! If you are not interested please pass onto colleagues/associates as we do offer referral bonuses.

Client is requiring Selenium experience as they are transitioning from Manual to Automation. They also require someone who has worked in an Agile environment. You will be joining a team of 4 that is offshore at this time but will be transitioning back to the US in the next few years. They also would like to see someone who understands how Magento 2 works conceptually (from an admin standpoint). Experience w/ E-Commerce is absolutely required.

The E-Commerce Quality lead is a hybrid role with end-to-end responsibility for delivering application quality. In order to ensure quality, this role will be responsible for aligning business requirements to business needs through requirements elicitation and definition, development of user stories, and design of wireframes (typical business analysis tasks). Additionally, they will ensure that software developed meets all business requirements, is stable, performant, and secure (typical quality assurance tasks). This role will be a leader for our onshore and offshore quality assurance analysts and will partner with our technical architect and software development team leads to establish needed tools and processes to ensure quality.

Define and document functional requirements of an application (use cases, user stories, features). Define and document non-functional requirements of an application (stability, performance, usability, maintainability, security). Document as-is and to-be business processes and workflows needed to support application design and maintenance. Document multi-system data flow and architecture needed to support detailed technical integration design. Identify relative business priority of various initiatives and ensure that team deliverables are aligned to business priorities. Monitor deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects. Define quality standards and metrics for multiple parallel work streams. Work with all stake holders to ensure that the quality metrics are reviewed and agreed upon. Make the QA team aware of the quality metrics. Track and report out current status and trend over time against key quality metrics. Document, manage and prioritize issues in Jira (issue tracking system) and follow up to ensure resolution by the development team. Communicate critical issue status and resolution to all concerned stakeholders (customers, customer service, solutions team, marketing team). Create structured test strategies and plans for all projects. Set processes for test plan reviews and ensure that that test plans get reviewed by all stakeholders. Ensure all development tasks meet quality criteria through test planning, test execution, quality assurance and issue tracking. Develop and execute test cases, scripts, plans and procedures. Ensure that test strategies include unit, functional, performance, stress, usability, security testing, etc. Plan and facilitate user acceptance testing sessions. Lead multiple work streams of quality assurance originating from development, business requirements, and strategy. Responsible for coaching, mentoring, training and day to day interaction with a team of QA professionals (testers, automation experts, planners). Oversee all aspects of quality assurance including establishing metrics, applying industry best practices, and developing new tools and processes to ensure quality goals are met. Act as key point of contact for all QA aspects of releases, providing QA services and coordinating QA resources internally and externally. Support the team in creating reusable test assets for both manual and automated test scripts. Continuously improve QA processes and procedures.

  • provided by Dice QA, Quality Assurance, E-Commerce, Selenium, Manual, Automation, Agile

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Mobile Developer, QA/Test Developer
Industry: Data & Analytics, Financial Technology, Mobile Payments
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

 Nymcard is looking for a couple QAs with experience in mobile automation. These positions will sit on the R&D side in a fast-paced truly agile environment with a rockstar team.

Responsibilities

  • Develop from scratch the mobile automation roadmap
  • Work closely with mobile developers in order to architect, design, and implement automated tests for Android and IOS.
  • Lead and Empower QA teams to do their own automation with the help of right tools and strategies.

To qualify for the role you must have

  • 5+ years of QA experience working with different projects and technologies, which is different from have experienced the same year 5 times.
  • Hands on experience working with more than one of the leading industry mobile automation tools such as Appium, Calabash, Espresso, etc.

Ideally, you’ll also have

  • Strong knowledge and extensive experience in various types of testing (Automation, Functional, Regression, Integration, Smoke, etc.)
  • Experience in testing RESTful APIs

Pluses:

If you have what we are looking for above, reach out! Everything below is either something you are aware of already, or we will provide you the opportunity to learn on the job. Experience in the Financial industry.

Teams at NymCard

Teams at NymCard are relatively fluid. Some people stay on a given team for a handful of months, while others seem to prefer sticking to their team permanently. Once you join, we’ll work with you to choose a team to get started with—it’s all pretty flexible.

You should include these in your application:

Links to online profiles you use (GitHub, Twitter, etc). A description of your work history (whether as a resume, LinkedIn profile, or in the form of a cover letter).

Benefits

Remote work - Mission driven - Meaningful ownership - Working on new technologies

About NymCard

NymCard’s vision is to deliver the best mobile payment experience for millions of people in the new market opportunity of Middle East & Africa. NymCard helps traditional banks reach more people and increase their card based transactions and helps merchants grow their business by delivering relevant and engaging card linked experiences. All packaged in the most user friendly mobile wallet experience.

Benefits

Remote work
Competitive compensation
Flexible timing, deliveries is what matters
Tackling a new market opportunity
Working on the latest technologies
